question: Statement-I: Adiabatic work done is positive when work is done on the system and internal energy of the system increases.
Statement-II: No work is done during free expansion of an ideal gas.
Choose the correct answer:
choices: Both statements - I and Statement - II are false
Statement - I is true but statement - II is false
Statement - I is false but statement - II is true
Both statements - I and Statement - II are true
explanation: S-I: In adiabatic process (<katex>$q=0$</katex>), <katex>$\Delta U = w$</katex>. Work done on system (<katex>$w>0$</katex>) increases <katex>$\Delta U$</katex>. True.
S-II: Free expansion means expansion against zero external pressure (<katex>$P_{ext}=0$</katex>). <katex>$w = -P_{ext}\Delta V = 0$</katex>. True.
